hard_constraints.description: The property of being a perfect number is strictly reserved for those integers whose value is equivalent to the arithmetic sum of their proper divisors.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- perfect(N), S = #sum { M : num(M), M < N, N \ M = 0 }, S != N.

hard_constraints.description: Every integer within the defined domain that satisfies the condition where the sum of its proper divisors equals the integer itself must be classified as a perfect number.
hard_constraints.asp_rule: :- num(N), S = #sum { M : num(M), M < N, N \ M = 0 }, S = N, not perfect(N).
